title: Meet Shawna Pandya, 3rd Indian-origin woman astronaut & space scientist!29 min ago
text: Meet Shawna Pandya, 3rd Indian-origin woman astronaut & space scientist! Other than being an astronaut, she is also an opera singer, author, and international taekwondo champion. By Nithya Nair | Updated: February 9, 2017 1:49 PM IST Comments Shawna Pandya, a neurosurgeon who is working as a general physician in Canadaâ€™s Alberta University Hospital has become the third Indian-origin woman to fly to space. Pandya is the third woman of Indian origin after Kalpana Chawla and Sunita Williams. The 32-year-old with roots in Mumbai was among the candidates shortlisted from 3,200 people after she topped the Citizen Science Astronaut (CSA) program. In a space mission scheduled for 2018, she will fly with eight other astronauts. She is currently in Mumbai to meet her family who stays in Mahalaxmi. Pandya said that becoming an astronaut was her passion as a teenager. She is also preparing for two space missions. Other than her love for space, she is also an opera singer, author, and international taekwondo champion. She has also trained in Muay Thai with a Navy SEAL. Panya will be sent to space on a mission to conduct experiments in biomedicine and medical science. Pandya is also a part of Polar Suborbital Science in the Upper Mesosphere (PoSSUM) to study the effects of climate change. As per a Hindustan Times report, Pandya will also work on physiological, health, and environmental observations in microgravity (PHEnOM). She is also a crew member of Project Poseidon in Aquarius Space Research Facility in Florida which is a 100-day underwater mission. Remembering Kalpana Chawla: Girl who dreamt of stars Shawna Pandya was one among the Twitterati to post tweets on #DressLikeAWoman after a Mumbai college principal said that polycystic ovarian syndrome is common enough women because they dress like men.
